Dear Ms. Marry:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, a provisional license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and feel free to contact me with
any questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please feel free to contact the local office at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Patricia Neitman, Licensing Consultant
Bureau of Children and Adult Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The Agency is located at 131 S. Winter Street, Adrian, MI 49221. The agency is
comprised of a large space, approximately 3500 square feet. The space has been
recently remodeled, and has been leased for 3 years by the Agency. Copies of the
lease agreement were obtained. The Agency has a reception area with a waiting room.
There is a kitchen, two rooms set up for birth family visitation, which contain comfortable
couches and chairs, toys, etc. There is a large office area, where the foster care,
adoption, and certification staff will work. There are restrooms, and secure space to
store records in locked cabinets. The office space is sprinkled for fire safety. There are
also several offices which will be used for outpatient counseling, and a large conference
room. The Agency is located in downtown Adrian, and has a large parking lot. There
was determined to be appropriate office, visit, and meeting space, as well as secure
space to store records.
B. Program Description
Fostering Solutions is a child placing agency, whose programs consist of foster care,
foster home certification, evaluating applicants for adoption, and placing children for
adoption. Policies and procedures were reviewed for all programs, and were
determined to meet compliance with licensing rules, applicable statutes, DHS contract,
and the MSA. The Agency is in process of obtaining a contract with DHS for both foster
care and adoption. At this time, the staff will consist of three people; Chief Administrator
Jacquelyn Marry, Samantha Cowan, and Leslie Conrad. All three people have
2

completed CWTI training necessary for their assigned foster care and adoption worker
and supervisory duties, and Ms. Marry and Ms. Cowan have completed BCAL
certification and complaint training. Duties have been assigned between the three such
that no one will supervise their own duties. All three have previous foster care,
certification, and adoption experiences. The Agency’s adoption program will complete
both DHS adoptions once a contract is issued, as well as domestic voluntary adoptions.
A budget for the first three years was reviewed. A copy of the Agency’s 501c3 non-
profit status was received. Credentials for the three current staff were reviewed.
A board of directors has been established, consisting of Board President Kristen
Wetzel, Vice President Fred Smith, Secretary/Treasurer Elliot Bailey, and Member
Michelle Forde. A clinical therapist and out-patient therapists will be hired to provide
counseling services for clients and the community.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There are no rule or statutory violations.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of an original provisional license to this child placing agency,
private.
10/16/14

Patricia Neitman Date
